data.text: Then I saw 10:1 a ¦ another ANT CT TRa mighty angel coming down from heaven, wrapped in a cloud, with a rainbow over his head; his face was like the sun, and his feet were like pillars of fire.
In his hand he held 10:2 an open scroll ¦ a little scroll that was open BYZ CT PCK TRan open scroll. He placed his right foot on the sea and his left foot on the land,
and cried out with a loud voice, like a lion roaring. When he cried out, the seven thunders sounded their voices.

And when the seven thunders 10:4 spoke ¦ sounded their voices TRspoke, I was about to write. But I heard a voice from heaven 10:4 saying ¦ saying to me TRsaying, “Seal up what the seven thunders have said, and 10:4 do not ¦ after this yoʋ can PCKdo not write it down.”
Then the angel I had seen standing on the sea and on the land raised his 10:5 right ¦ --- TRright hand to heaven
and swore by him who lives forever and ever, who created heaven and everything in it, the earth and everything in it, and the sea and everything in it, and said that there would no longer be delay,

but that in the days when the seventh angel is about to sound his trumpet, the mystery of God would be completed, 10:7 according to the good news he announced ¦ which was announced as good news PCKaccording to the good news he announced to his servants the prophets.
Then the voice I had heard from heaven spoke to me again, saying, “Go take the 10:8 little ¦ --- CTlittle scroll that is open in the hand of the angel who is standing on the sea and on the land.”

So I went over to the angel and 10:9 asked him to give me the little scroll. ¦ said to him, “Give me the little scroll.” Αν BYZ PCK TRasked him to give me the little scroll. And he said to me, “Take the scroll and eat it. It will make yoʋr stomach bitter, but in yoʋr mouth it will be as sweet as honey.”
So I took the 10:10 scroll ¦ little scroll BYZ CT PCK TRscroll from the angel's hand and ate it. In my mouth it was as sweet as honey, but when I had eaten it, my stomach turned bitter.
Then I was told, “Yoʋ must prophesy again about many peoples, nations, tongues, and kings.”
